title: Factor into Primes
text: Factor each coefficient into primes and write the variables with exponents in expanded form. A prime number is a counting number greater than $$1$$, whose only factors are $$1$$ and itself. The first few prime numbers are: $$2$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$11$$, $$13$$, etc.

title: Factor First Expression
text: $$28x^2 y^4=7\times2\times2 x x y y y y$$

title: Factor Second Expression
text: $$42x^4 y^4=7\times3\times2 x x x x y y y y$$

title: Identify Common Factors in each Column
text: $$28x^2 y^4=7\times2\times2 x x y y y y$$\n$$42x^4 y^4=7\times3\times2 x x x x y y y y$$\n$$7$$, $$2$$, $$x$$, $$x$$, $$y$$, $$y$$, $$y$$, and $$y$$ are shared by both expressions.

title: Multiply Common Factors
text: Bring down the $$7$$, $$2$$, $$x$$, $$x$$, $$y$$, $$y$$, $$y$$, and $$y$$, and then multiply.\n$$GCF=7\times2 x x y y y y$$
